intro: Palicourea norae, commonly known as the "blue mist" or "blue star" plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking blue flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences, and its lance-shaped, glossy leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
